result.execSummary:
The defendant John D. Koenig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Cases 22CF436, 21CM836 dismissed and read in. 
Two days credit if revoked from Probation.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

Participate in and successfully complete Eau Claire County treatment court. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide a DNA sample.

No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
No contact with Officer Lokkesmoe or Officer Asselin outside their official capacities. 
No contact with Racy Delane's Coffee, The Pickle, or Shenanigans.
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: All except 30 days is Stayed pending further order of the court.

records.addlTxt:
1:57 PM cases 21CF1233, 21CF1321, 21CM836, 22CF436, 22CF467 called. Defendant John D. Koenig in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for John D. Koenig.  Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
In 21CF1233: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged in the Information. 
In 21CF1321: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2 as charged in the Information. 
In 22CF467: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping (no repeater). 
Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 

Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 3 years with conditions: 
Defendant to participate in and successfully complete Eau Claire County Treatment Court. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide a DNA sample. Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
No contact with Officer Lokkesmoe or Officer Asselin outside of their official capacities. 
No contact with Racy Delane's Coffee, Shenanigans or The Pickle on Water Street. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
As to count 2 in 21CF1321: 9 months in Jail all except 30 days Stayed pending further order of the court. 
If revoked, defendant has 5 days credit in 21CF1233, 3 days in 21CF1321, 2 days in 22CF467.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachments)

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in each felony files and Court accepts waiver. 
Cases referred to Br. 1 to set arraignment. 21CM836 will ride along.
